channel.title: Applet in JFrame?
channel.description:
Well, so far I have made a JFrame with a menubar, buttons, and that stuff but now i wanna add an applet to it.
I have googled it and tried various methods but none of them have worked for me.
So lets say I want the runescape applet on the JFrame like world switchers do, how would i go about doing this?

item.title: Applet in JFrame?
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

It was in 5.0 JFrame.add started calling Jframe.getContentPane().add()

Read full topic

item.title: Applet in JFrame?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Rune Hacker:

Im sorry but can someone give a basic example of what to do because ive tried loads of different ways but none of them work lol.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/
All the tutorials and examples you’ll ever need!

Read full topic

item.title: Applet in JFrame?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:7, topic:137275”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=188822.msg1704869#msg1704869 date=1188173227]
No pwnd, for JFrame’s you use getContentPane().

frame.getContentPane().add(app);
[/quote]
In Java 6, [tt]JFrame.add()[/tt] automatically calls [tt]JFrame.getContentPane().add()[/tt][/quote]

Well, I still think that getContentPane() is proper coding convention.

Read full topic

frame.getContentPane().add(app);[/quote]

item.title: Applet in JFrame?
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Rictoo:

Lookup the API for AppletStub, you’d need to override some methods and stuff, and then for the Applet you would use the runescape loader.

Umm, either english since im still pretty new to Java or if possible, a tiny example, idk

Read full topic

item.title: Applet in JFrame?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Uhh

JFrame frame = new JFrame(“This holds an applet”);
Applet app = …
frame.add(app);

Ofc you’ll have to do some things with your applet like call start() and/or init()

Read full topic
